alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Central La Paz; Central Phoenix; East Valley; Gila Bend; North Phoenix, Glendale; Northwest Pinal County; Northwest Valley; Scottsdale, Paradise Valley; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Tonopah Desert; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 4:51PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern La Paz, northeastern Yuma, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 530 PM MST... At 451 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from 8 miles south of Gladden to Estrella Mountain Park to Arizola. Movement was northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs, blow around unsecured objects, and generate blowing dust. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Mesa, Chandler, Glendale, Gilbert, Tempe, Surprise, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, Casa Grande, El Mirage, Florence, Coolidge, Tolleson, Youngtown, Gila Bend, Waddell, Sun City and Wittmann. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 57 and 204. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 206. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 108 and 178. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
